column1: 581A2FC4-331D-4BCB-92E3-540F7FF12420#appfire#3EEF05F6-12D4-4913-9C35-09CC2F03E394#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-02 07:39:11.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-02 07:39:11.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#A720EBE1-1148-4D37-BD96-1D2BBB255CA4#appfire#3EEF05F6-12D4-4913-9C35-09CC2F03E394#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-02 07:39:11.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-02 07:39:11.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#E98953E6-9576-43E9-BC21-F681736B152D#appfire#3EEF05F6-12D4-4913-9C35-09CC2F03E394#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-02 07:39:11.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-02 07:39:11.0#appfire#1
